HL7 Standard.summary: The Da Vinci Coverage Requirements Discovery (CRD) Implementation Guide is fundamentally based on FHIR, leveraging its RESTful API and resource model for exchanging coverage information. It heavily utilizes CDS Hooks, a specification built on top of FHIR, for real-time interactions. While it acknowledges other HL7 standards, they are not central to its core functionality. The IG does not directly use or reference CDA, v2, or v3.

Geographic Scope.summary: The Da Vinci CRD Implementation Guide is explicitly designed for the US healthcare system. It references US Core profiles, utilizes US-specific terminologies (CPT, CMS location codes), aligns with CMS initiatives, and addresses the US-specific problem of prior authorization. Therefore, it is classified as a National IG for the United States.

Domain Focus.summary: The Da Vinci Coverage Requirements Discovery (CRD) IG primarily focuses on streamlining the process of determining coverage requirements for healthcare services between providers and payers. It leverages CDS Hooks to enable real-time interaction and uses FHIR resources and extensions to convey coverage information. While it touches upon clinical data and workflow, its core purpose is to reduce administrative burden and improve the efficiency of coverage determination, making it heavily centered around administrative and financial aspects of healthcare.

Implementers.summary: The Da Vinci Coverage Requirements Discovery (CRD) IG focuses on automating the exchange of coverage information between providers and payers. It leverages CDS Hooks within EHR systems to query payer systems for coverage details, primarily impacting EHRs, Payer Systems, and Clinical Decision Support systems. Other systems have limited or no involvement.

Users & Stakeholders.summary: The Da Vinci Coverage Requirements Discovery (CRD) IG primarily focuses on streamlining the interaction between healthcare providers and payers to determine coverage for services. Clinical Care Teams are the core users, driving the need for real-time coverage information. Payers are key influencers, as their systems and rules dictate the coverage responses. Healthcare Administrators benefit from reduced administrative burden. While other groups have a role, their influence is less significant in this specific IG.
